overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach focused on handling data anomalies and leveraging daily seasonality. It identifies the constant values on the last day as an anomaly, excludes them to avoid bias, and uses simple averaging of same-hour data from valid days to generate a repeating daily pattern forecast. The method is straightforward but effective given data constraints, prioritizing pattern recognition over complex modeling.
common_data_patterns: Anomaly detection (constant values treated as missing data)
Handling of missing values through exclusion
key_insights: Exclusion of anomalous data (constant values) to prevent forecast distortion
Use of same-hour averaging across multiple days to capture daily seasonality
Data rounding to match original precision (3 decimal places)
Prioritization of recent valid data (Dec 28-30) over anomalous data (Dec 31)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with emphasis on data diagnostics: Involves anomaly detection, data exclusion decisions, and step-by-step pattern calculation, but relies on basic averaging rather than advanced statistical models.
